Understate: The claim understates the fact that the photo has been circulating since 2012, before Narendra Modi became the Prime Minister of India.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough supporting evidence to prove that the banner was erected by China in Ladakh in June 2020.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the "FIGHT TO WIN" banner was erected by China as a message to Narendra Modi, without sufficient evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The photo has an alternative explanation that it was taken in 2012 and is not related to the recent tensions between China and India in Ladakh.
